intro: Sanicula marilandica, commonly known as Maryland cowbane, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has a fibrous root system. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. The plant is often found in shaded environments and is adapted to thrive in rich, loamy soils.
